title: The assbackwards Ryze change: he's going to be even worse in soloQ, and even stronger in competitive
body: It actually blows my mind that they thought the appropriate course of action for balancing this champion was to remove options that let him thrive independently more often while adding even more power to his ultimate.

replies.body: Apparently learning a 2 button combo that makes you invincible in 1v1 (massive shield) was too complicated for your average player to grasp, shrug

This is satire right? Not like, the sarcasm of saying people can't learn a 2-button combo; the notion that that's all that separates organized play from solo queue.

Because if not it's beyond absurd how wrong it is. Ryze in pro play is playing an entirely different game than we can. Lagless LAN environments let Ryze machine gun spell rotations much faster and much more reliably than we can fathom for our server games.

The biggest thing is that his ult is significantly worse outside of an environment with coordinated wave management, macro, and voice chat. It is really difficult to overstate how fucking busted his ult is with heavy coordination. Meanwhile the damn thing is extremely unreliable to exploit in SoloQ even at a Challenger level. They took that problematic ult and made it even more powerful.
